description.narrative: Myndigheten för samhällsskydd och beredskap (MSB) och Sector for Emergency Management (SEM) vid Inrikesministeriet i Serbien har gemensamt lagt fram ett projektförslag för finansiering av projektet "Reducing Risks in Serbia Through Improved Emergency Management Coordination" i Serbien under perioden 1 februari 2019 till 31 december 2020. Insatsen syftar till att stärka Serbiens krishantering. Insatsen kommer att bidra till Serbiens EU-integration genom att stärka serbiska myndigheter inom ”Disaster Risk Management, DRM”. Totala budgeten är 13 040 000 kronor och Sidas avtalsparten är MSB och Inrikesministeriet. Sida är ensam finansiär av projektet.

Swedish Civil Contingencies Agency (MSB) and the Sector for Emergency Management of the Ministry of Interior in Serbia have applied to Sida for funding of 13 040 000 SEK to carry out "Reduction Risk in Serbia Through Improved Emergency Management Coordination" project in Serbia during the period 1 February 2019 to 31 December 2020. The intervention aims at reducing risks at national and local level through improved emergency management coordination. MSB will implement the intervention together with Ministry of Interior of the Republic of Serbia. The intervention’s total budget is 13 040 000 SEK and it shall be completely funded from Sida's contribution.

The intervention aims to support Serbian Ministry of Interior (MoI), Sector for Emergency Management (SEM) to establish well functioning coordination of the emergency management institutions, that are responsible for planning and implementation of disaster risk management and disaster risk reduction at both national and local level. The project goal can be achieved by improving SEM's functional and technical capacity in exercise organisation, emergency coordination and risk-informed emergency management, thereby enhancing SEM’s ability to support other responsible national and local actors in emergency coordination as well as in risk-informed emergency management. The project aims at achieving the following outcomes: Outcome 1: Enhanced technical and functional capacity to implement emergency coordination exercises 1.1 Enhanced procedures for systematic planning and evaluation of exercises 1.2 Further strengthened exercise management 1.3 Further strengthened exercise methodology 1.4 Further developed exercise portfolio (table-top exercises in coordination for local governments)
Outcome 2: Reinforced working methods for coordination in emergency situations 2.1 Increased understanding of preconditions, approaches and methods for command and multi-stakeholder coordination in emergency situations within SEM/MoI 2.2 Increased understanding of preconditions, approaches and methods for command and multi-stakeholder coordination in emergency situations within exercised participants at local level 2.3 SEM/MoI has further developed working methods and operating procedures for command and control in emergency situations
Outcome 3: Enhanced capacity at SEM/MoI to make use of geospatial risk information 3.1 Enhanced capacity to utilise Geographic Information System (GIS) as a tool in Disaster Risk Reduction (DRR) and emergency response activities at national level 3.2 Enhanced capacity to utilise geospatial risk information to support local emergency coordination

tag.narrative: 11.5 - By 2030, significantly reduce the number of deaths and the number of people affected and substantially decrease the direct economic losses relative to global gross domestic product caused by disasters, including water-related disasters, with a focus on protecting the poor and people in vulnerable situations.

11.5 - Till 2030 väsentligt minska antalet dödsfall och antalet människor som drabbas av katastrofer, inklusive vattenrelaterade katastrofer. Även tillse att de direkta ekonomiska förlusterna till följd av sådana katastrofer, i form av lägre global BNP, minskar väsentligt. Särskilt fokus bör ligga på att skydda de fattiga och människor i utsatta situationer.

13.3 - Förbättra utbildningen, medvetenheten och den mänskliga och institutionella kapaciteten vad gäller begränsning av klimatförändringarna, klimatanpassning, begränsning av klimatförändringarnas konsekvenser samt tidig varning.
13.3 - Improve education, awareness-raising and human and institutional capacity on climate change mitigation, adaptation, impact reduction and early warning.

title.narrative: Contribution Agreement with the Ministry of Interior disaster risk management
Decision on contribution disaster risk management
Grant Agreement with MSB disaster risk management

description.narrative: The contribution started in January 2019, with the Inception Phase agreed to last nine months. By September 30th, Sida's agreement partner, MSB, was supposed to submit detailed action plan and updated budget for the remaining period of project implementation. These documents were delayed and situation within the project required engagement from the development cooperation staff at the Embassy of Sweden in Belgrade in order to facilitate dialogue between Serbian (Sector for Emergency Management of the Ministry of Interior) and Swedish (MSB) partners. At the end of the intensive dialogue process that involved all three sides, a detailed action plan for the project year 2020 and the related budget were developed and approved. The process that took place during period October-November 2019 was important for clarifying issues that quite unexpectedly emerged such as: roles and responsibilities of project partners and operationalisation of project goals, its outcomes and outputs. Since the project started with a nine-months Inception period, and having in mind that additional two months were spent on consultations with the donor, at this point we can not talk of any concrete results achieved within the project. Progress of the project at the end of the first year could be summarized as following: - During the Inception phase, project partners have conducted a capacity assessment workshop in May 2019. - Three table-top exercises for the benefit of local governments were organized in 2019, with MSB observer and advisory. - SEM and MSB worked jointly on project action plan, and agreed that a long-term MSB consultant would be selected and posted to work within SEM during 2020.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
